intro: [WRONG START] Cuzeta gossypiantha, commonly known as the woolly crosswort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
